greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: Product_{n>=1} ((1-x^n)/(1+x^n))^(2*n).
comment: The number of contiguous signs seems to increase in proportion to the square-root of the number of terms.
Compare the g.f. to the Jacobi theta_4 series identity:
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms 0..2500 from Paul D. Hanna)
formula: G.f.: exp( Sum_{n>=1} -(sigma_2(2*n) - sigma_2(n))*x^n/n ) where sigma_2(n) = sum of squares of divisors of n.
example: where the g.f. equals the infinite product:
The logarithm of the g.f. is illustrated by:
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 06 2012
